Package helio.framework.materialiser.mappings

Interface DataHandler

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
public interface DataHandler
extends Serializable
This class is meant to be implemented by objects that will handle pieces of data in a specific format, allowing the MaterialiserEngine to split data, and access specific pieces, in order to generate a final RDF document
Author:
Andrea Cimmino

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void configure​(com.google.gson.JsonObject configuration)
    This method is expected to receive a JsonObject with the necessary information to setup an implementation of this interface.
    List<String> filter​(String filter, String dataChunk)
    This method must select one or more elements from a chunk of data, using a provided filter (like a Json Path or a XPat)
    Queue<String> splitData​(InputStream dataStream)
    This method split the provided data into chunks using some iterator, like a Json Path or an XPat (usually provided as part of the configuration)

  • Method Details

    • splitData

      Queue<String> splitData​(InputStream dataStream)
      This method split the provided data into chunks using some iterator, like a Json Path or an XPat (usually provided as part of the configuration)
      Parameters:
      dataStream - A stream containing the data to be translated into RDF, that has a specific format that this Data Handler knows how to manage
      Returns:
      a Queue in which each element corresponds to a chunk of data

    • filter

      List<String> filter​(String filter, String dataChunk)
      This method must select one or more elements from a chunk of data, using a provided filter (like a Json Path or a XPat)
      Parameters:
      filter - the filtering expression
      dataChunk - the piece of data from which extract the information using the filtering expression
      Returns:
      all the occurrences found in the piece of data using the filtering expression

    • configure

      void configure​(com.google.gson.JsonObject configuration)
      This method is expected to receive a JsonObject with the necessary information to setup an implementation of this interface.

      Check the documentation of the implementations to know more about the different configurations required by those implementations.

      Parameters:
      configuration - a suitable configuration
